intro: Albuca gilletii, commonly known as the yellow bulbous plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bulbous base and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers during the warmer months. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils. Albuca gilletii is drought-tolerant and prefers full sun to partial shade.
